seo.title: Kling 2.6 Pro – AI Text & Image to Video with Native Audio | MaxVideoAI
seo.description: Generate cinematic AI videos with Kling 2.6 Pro inside MaxVideoAI. Turn text or images into short clips with native dialogue, ambience and sound effects—ideal for emotional storytelling, product ads, social videos and VFX previz.

overview: Kling 2.6 Pro in MaxVideoAI: short-form cinematic clips with native audio, text or image input, 1080p output, 5–10s runs, and audio on/off toggle.

hero.title: Kling 2.6 Pro – Cinematic AI Video with Native Audio
hero.intro: Dialogue-ready cinematic clips from text or a single frame — with native audio that matches the scene.

items.title: Social promos with polished motion + sound
VFX / motion design previs with synced audio

technicalOverview.label: Inputs
technicalOverview.body: Text → Video; Image → Video (PNG/JPG/WebP), prompt + negative + seed

technicalOverview.label: Audio
technicalOverview.body: Native audio on by default; toggle off for silent runs

technicalOverview.label: Pricing
technicalOverview.body: Per-second; example: $0.14/s audio on, $0.07/s audio off

promptStructure.title: Prompting Kling 2.6 Pro
promptStructure.quote: Cinematic [subject] in [setting], [camera move], [lighting/grade], [duration 5–10s], aspect [16:9/9:16/1:1], audio with [dialogue/ambience/SFX].
promptStructure.description: Write concise, shot-level prompts: subject, motion, style, duration and audio.

tips.title: Tips & limits
items: Keep clips to 5–10s and one clear action.
Use 9:16 for social verticals; 16:9 for widescreen.
Keep dialogue short; refine with negative prompts to avoid extra subjects.
Audio on by default—toggle off when scoring separately.

prompts.title: Cinematic dialogue alley
prompts.prompt: Two friends walk through a rain-soaked neon alley at night, camera tracks at shoulder height, reflective puddles, soft thunder, quiet dialogue: “Did you get the shot?” “Yeah, Kling 2.6 nailed it.”

prompts.title: Product hero vertical
prompts.prompt: Vertical close-up of a smartwatch rotating over a soft neon gradient background, camera dolly with gentle parallax, crisp reflections, 1080p, subtle electronic ambience and SFX.

faqs.a: Yes, native audio is on by default. You can toggle it off for silent exports.
Text → Video and Image → Video in a single card. No first/last frame in this routing.
Stay within 5–10s for strong beats. Stitch multiple renders for longer narratives.

custom.heroSupportLine: Best for short ads, mini-stories, and VFX beats where emotion + sound matter.
custom.heroDesc1: Cinematic 5–10s clips where video, dialogue, ambience, sound effects, and music are generated together in one pass at 1080p. Text or image input in a single card, with native audio in English and Chinese built in.
custom.heroDesc2: Use Kling 2.6 Pro when you need emotionally rich motion with fully synced sound; toggle audio off for silent drafts or manual sound design.
heroHighlights: Native audio in one pass||Dialogue, ambience, and SFX land in sync with the visuals.
Speech-ready outputs||Built-in voice support for English and Chinese lines.
Cinematic intent holds up||Clear camera direction and beats translate with less drift.
Flexible for post||Keep audio on for drafts, or mute and finish sound in your editor.
custom.specTitle: Real Specs – Kling 2.6 Pro in MaxVideoAI
custom.specNote: Specs reflect the live Fal routing today.

specSections.title: Audio-ready cinematics
specSections.intro: Generates dialogue, ambience, and SFX in sync with the visuals. Best for emotional beats and mini-stories.
items: Keep beats short for tight sync.

specSections.title: Speech & post flexibility
specSections.intro: Built-in speech support helps for character lines, while you can still mute and finish in post. Use it when sound is part of the story.
items: Leave room for a music bed if needed.
Mute if you plan a full mix.

custom.whatTitle: How Kling 2.6 Pro works in MaxVideoAI
custom.whatIntro1: Pick text or image mode, set 5 or 10 seconds at 1080p, choose aspect (16:9/9:16/1:1), toggle audio, and prompt.
custom.whatIntro2: Use Kling 2.6 Pro when you need dialogue-ready clips with strong motion and synced ambience.
whatFlowSteps: Select Kling 2.6 Pro (Text → Video or Image → Video)
Audio on/off, add prompt and optional negative/seed
Upload one reference still for I2V when needed
See live price chip, then generate
custom.galleryIntro: Recent Kling 2.6 Pro renders with native audio for dialogue, ambience, and emotional storytelling.
strengths: Write camera-first: framing + angle + a single move (dolly / pan / slow handheld drift), then style.
Keep the visual beat simple (one subject, one clear action). Short beats sync best with audio.
If audio is on: add minimal cues (ambience + 1 key SFX) and keep dialogue to one short line.
State the spoken line explicitly, then leave room for sound (don’t over-direct the mix).
Generate 2–3 takes for timing; pick the one where lip sync and pacing land.
boundaries: Speech output is English/Chinese (other languages may be auto-translated to English when audio is enabled).
Image→Video uses a single reference image; tiny on-screen text remains unreliable (overlay in post).
custom.promptingTitle: How to Write a Great Kling 2.6 Pro Prompt
custom.promptingIntro: Kling 2.6 Pro prefers clear subject, action, and camera direction; add sound cues if audio is on.
custom.promptingTip: Tip: duration + aspect ratio are set in the UI - your prompt controls subject, action, camera, lighting, style, and optional sound. Use Negative prompt to block artifacts.
promptingGlobalPrinciples: One subject, one action, one camera move.
Call out lighting and lens feel.
Add short sound cues or dialogue if audio is on.
custom.tipsIntro: Kling 2.6 Pro is easiest to steer when you write a tight shot brief and treat audio as part of the scene (not an afterthought).
promptingEngineWhy: Audio mode supports simple ambience and short lines.
Negative prompts help remove text/logos/extra characters.

promptingTabNotes.quick: Quick = variations. Use for fast iteration.
promptingTabNotes.structured: Structured = consistency. Use when you need reliable results.
promptingTabNotes.pro: Pro = continuity. Use for precise, repeatable looks.
promptingTabNotes.storyboard: Storyboard = beat timing. Use for mini-stories in one clip.

demoPrompt: Two friends walk through a rain-soaked neon alley at night, camera tracks at shoulder height, reflective puddles, soft thunder, quiet dialogue: “Did you get the shot?” “Yeah, Kling 2.6 nailed it.”

promptingTabs.label: Quick
promptingTabs.title: Quick prompt (fast iteration)
promptingTabs.description: Use 1–2 sentences when you want variations.
promptingTabs.copy:
Prompt: [Subject + action] in [setting], [camera move], [lighting/style], [sound cue].
Negative: [text, logos, extra limbs, blur]

promptingTabs.label: Structured
promptingTabs.title: Structured prompt (best for reliable results)
promptingTabs.description: Separate information so the model can follow it consistently.
promptingTabs.copy:
Subject:
[Who/what + one action.]

Setting:
[Where + time + 2 anchors.]

Camera:
[Shot + angle + one move + lens feel.]

Look:
[Lighting + palette.]

Sound (optional):
[Ambience + 1-2 SFX cues or a short line.]

Negative:
[What to avoid.]

promptingTabs.label: Pro
promptingTabs.title: Pro prompt (ultra-specific "film crew brief")
promptingTabs.description: Use this when you need a very specific cinematic look or continuity across shots.
promptingTabs.copy:
Brief:
[Goal + vibe.]

Subject + wardrobe:
[Traits + materials.]

Set:
[Location + 3 anchors.]

Cinematography:
[Framing + angle + one move + lens.]

Lighting + grade:
[Key light + contrast + palette.]

Sound (optional):
[Ambience + SFX + short dialogue.]

Negative:
[Text, logos, extra characters, artifacts.]

promptingTabs.label: Storyboard
promptingTabs.title: Storyboard prompt (multi-shot / shot list)
promptingTabs.description: Use this when you want a mini-story in one clip. A storyboard prompt (aka multi-shot / shot list prompt) gives clear timing, camera direction, and continuity. Also called shot-list or sequenced prompts.
promptingTabs.copy:
Storyboard / shot list prompt
Duration: [5/10s] • Aspect: [16:9 or 9:16]

Scene + continuity:
[Same subject + same location + same wardrobe/props + same lighting throughout.]

Shot 1 (0–2s):
[Framing + subject action + camera move]

Shot 2 (2–6s):
[Framing + subject action + camera move]

Shot 3 (6–10s):
[Framing + final action/reveal + camera move or settle]

Lighting + mood:
[Golden hour / soft daylight / neon night… + 2–3 palette anchors]

Sound (if supported):
[Ambience + 1–2 SFX cues + optional music vibe]

Constraints:
No logos. No readable text. No subtitles/overlays. No jump cuts. No slow-motion.

troubleshootingItems: Dialogue/lip sync drifts → shorten the line, slow delivery, avoid long monologues; reduce head turns and fast facial performance.
Audio language mismatch → speech output is English/Chinese; if you need another language, turn audio off and dub in post.
Motion feels messy → one camera move only, slower action, simpler background.
Subject/identity drifts → start from Image→Video, keep wardrobe + lighting + palette constant, reuse the same wording across takes.
Random text/logos appear → add a short negative prompt (“no text, no logos, no UI”) and keep signage out of frame.
safetyRules: No sexual content, and nothing involving minors.
No hateful, harassing, or graphic-violence content.
Don’t impersonate real people or public figures; use consent for any likeness/voice.
Don’t include private personal data (addresses, phone numbers, documents, non-consenting faces).
Use only content you have rights to; some prompts/inputs may be blocked by provider safety filters.
